discussion.content:

A. Perform security code reviews on the entire application

choices.A: Perform security code reviews on the entire application

choices.C: Monitor Internet traffic for sensitive information leakage
choices.B: Scan the entire application using a vulnerability scanning tool

questions.question_text: When remote access to confidential information is granted to a vendor for analytic purposes, which of the following is the MOST important security consideration?

choices.C: Data is encrypted in transit and at rest at the vendor site
choices.B: The vendor must agree to the organization's information security policy
choices.D: Data is subject to regular access log review
choices.A: The vendor must be able to amend data

discussion.content: C. Data is encrypted in transit and at rest at the vendor site
C - Look at the choices from the view of which one of this if absent would be a concern for ISM

Selected Answer: B
B includes C and D.

Selected Answer: B
I'd say B because it's the most comprehensive answer. When signing a contract with a vendor it's good to include security requirements (like agreeing to ISP and whatever is stated there).

Selected Answer: D
The Data is not being transferred but ACCESS is given. Encryption is always good but knowing exactly what is being accessed is more critical. Sure you can have contracts and ask vendor to follow your security policy but you won't know if all of it is being followed unless there is an audit or issue which causes review. But access logs are crucial.

comments.content: But vendor is likely not going to run analytics on company's infrastructure, but will copy over the data to their systems.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Need to be able to review access logs of the data to make sure there is no misuse

Selected Answer: B
B. The vendor must agree to the organization's information security policy

comments.content:
Totally agree, with your answer and regd the responses that leave room for arguments. 

While it is true that the vendor has to agree with the security policy this is broadly applicable to all contracts. 

The question is specifically referring to remote access to sensitive data, and therefore encryption of data in transit and at rest is best choice.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think it's actually kind of a trick question, to where yes B should theoretically include C. But we don't know their current security policy therefore the most direct and apparent MOST important would be C. 

Once again, they should really remove ambiguous questions like this that leave room for arguments at to what exactly they mean.

Selected Answer: B
B because encrypting data in transit and in rest, must be a part of the security policy. Then security policy is higher level so this is the managers answer.

Selected Answer: B
It is B

The MOST important security consideration when remote access to confidential information is granted to a vendor for analytic purposes is that the vendor must agree to the organization's information security policy.

Selected Answer: B
When investigating an information security incident, the details of the incident should be shared B. only as needed.

Information security incidents involve sensitive and potentially confidential information. It is crucial to limit the dissemination of incident details to a need-to-know basis. Sharing the incident details only with individuals or teams directly involved in the incident response process helps maintain confidentiality, preserve the integrity of the investigation, and prevent unnecessary panic or disruption within the organization.

Selected Answer: B
B. only as needed

choices.C: current international standard was used to assess security processes
choices.A: certification scope is relevant to the service being offered
choices.D: certification can be extended to cover the client's business
